user_settings_camera_zoom_amount_descrip: Determines how far from the scene the camera is positioned.
user_settings_camera_type_description: Switching between camera projection type does not impact performance. You can choose the one that suits you better.
user_settings_dynamic_light_quality_desc: You can reduce overall dynamic light quality for better performance. With lower settings less light sources will be rendered in the scene. Disabling this means that every object will be uniformly highlighted and there will be no light sources that cast shadows.
user_settings_rendering_resolution_descr: You can reduce the rendering pixel ratio to decrease the rendering resolution, which makes everyting more blurry, but increases the performance.
user_settings_required_reload_to_take_ef: Required game reload to take effect.
user_settings_shadow_map_size_descriptio: Bigger values improve shadows quality, but affect performance and memory usage.
user_settings_show_rendering_stats_descr: Primarily used by game developers, but you can check your actual framerate and memory usage if you want to fine-tune your settings and you know what you are doing.
user_settings_use_offscreen_canvas_descr: This one is tricky. On faster devices it provides even better and snappier experience but on slower devices it can degrade the overall performance and introduce some graphical glitches. Overall you can safely turn this on and see if it makes a difference for you.
user_settings_use_shadows_description: If you are not using multiple light sources you can disable this option as well since it will provide almost no visual enhancements without dynamic lighting.
